member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.IsConnected
member.summary: Tests if the controller is currently connected.
member.remarks: Wireless controllers are not considered active upon system startup, and calls to any of the XInput functions before a wireless controller is made active return ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED. Game titles must examine the return code and be prepared to handle this condition. Wired controllers are automatically activated when they are inserted. Wireless controllers are activated when the user presses the START or Xbox Guide button to power on the controller.

member.name: M:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.GetBatteryInformation(<unknown type>,SlimDX.XInput.BatteryInformation@)
member.summary: Gets information on the controllers battery.
member.param: Input flags that identify the device type.
Out reference to BatteryInformation structure that receives the battery status information.

member.name: M:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.GetKeystroke(SlimDX.XInput.DeviceQueryType,SlimDX.XInput.KeyStroke@)
member.param: Input flags that identify the device type.
Out reference to KeyStroke structure that receives an input event.
member.returns: False if no new keys have been pressed.

member.name: M:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.GetDirectSoundAudioDeviceGuids(System.Guid@,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Retrieves the sound rendering and sound capture device GUIDs that are associated with the headset connected to the specified controller.
member.param: Out reference to Guid structure that receives the GUID of the headset sound rendering device.
Out reference to Guid structure that receives the GUID of the headset sound capture device.

member.name: M:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.GetCapabilities(SlimDX.XInput.DeviceQueryType,SlimDX.XInput.Capabilities@)
member.summary: Retrieves the capabilities and features of a connected controller.
member.param: Input flags that identify the device type.
Out reference to Capabilities structure that receives the controller capabilities.

member.name: M:SlimDX.XInput.Controller.SetState(SlimDX.XInput.Vibration@)
member.summary: Sends data to a connected controller. This function is used to activate the vibration function of a controller.
member.param: Reference structure containing the vibration information to send to the controller.

member.summary: Retrieves the current state of the specified controller.
member.param: Out reference to State structure that receives the current state of the controller.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of Controller

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.UserIndex
member.summary: Index of the signed-in gamer associated with the device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.DeviceQueryType
member.summary: Flags that identify the device type.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.BatteryLevel
member.summary: The amount of charge remaining in the battery.
member.remarks: These are only valid for wireless, connected devices, with known battery types. The amount of use time remaining depends on the type of device.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Capabilities.Vibration
member.summary: Vibration structure that describes available vibration functionality and resolutions.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Capabilities.Gamepad
member.summary: GamePad structure that describes available controller features and control resolutions.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Capabilities
member.summary: Describes the capabilities of a connected controller.
member.remarks: Sets the structure members to indicate which inputs the device supports. For binary state controls, such as digital buttons, the corresponding bit reflects whether or not the control is supported by the device. For proportional controls, such as thumbsticks, the value indicates the resolution for that control. Some number of the least significant bits may not be set, indicating that the control does not provide resolution to that level.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.VoiceSupported
member.summary: The device has an integrated voice device.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Gamepad
member.summary: The device is a game controller.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.State.Gamepad
member.summary: GamePad structure containing the current state of an Xbox 360 Controller.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.State.PacketNumber
member.summary: State packet number. The packet number indicates whether there have been any changes in the state of the controller. If the PacketNumber member is the same in sequentially returned State structures, the controller state has not changed.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.State
member.summary: Represents the state of a controller.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.KeyStroke.HidCode
member.summary: HID code corresponding to the input. If there is no corresponding HID code, this value is zero.

member.summary: Index of the signed-in gamer associated with the device. Can be a value in the range 0â€“3.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.KeyStroke.Flags
member.summary: Combination of flags that indicate the keyboard state at the time of the input event.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.KeyStroke.VirtualKey
member.summary: Virtual-key code of the key, button, or stick movement.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.KeyStroke
member.summary: Specifies keystroke data returned by Controller.GetKeystroke

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.KeyStrokeFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate the keyboard state at the time of the input event.

member.name: F:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.GamepadTriggerThreshold
member.summary: This constantmay be used as the value which LeftTrigger and RightTrigger must be greater than to register as pressed.

member.name: F:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.GamepadRightThumbDeadZone
member.summary: Can be used as a positive and negative value to filter the right thumbstick input.

member.name: F:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.GamepadLeftThumbDeadZone
member.summary: Can be used as a positive and negative value to filter the left thumbstick input.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.RightThumbY
member.summary: Right thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.RightThumbX
member.summary: Right thumbstick x-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.LeftThumbY
member.summary: Left thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.LeftThumbX
member.summary: Right thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.RightTrigger
member.summary: The current value of the right trigger analog control. The value is between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.LeftTrigger
member.summary: The current value of the left trigger analog control. The value is between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad.Buttons
member.summary: Bitmask of the device digital buttons

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.GamePad
member.summary: Describes the current state of the Xbox 360 Controller.
member.remarks: Each of the thumbstick axis members is a signed value between -32768 and 32767 describing the position of the thumbstick. A value of 0 is centered. Negative values signify down or to the left. Positive values signify up or to the right. The constants GamepadLeftThumbDeadZone or GamepadRightThumbDeadZone can be used as a positive and negative value to filter a thumbstick input.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.GamepadButtonFlags
member.summary: Bitmask of the device digital buttons

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.RightMotorSpeed
member.summary: Speed of the right motor. Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100 percent motor use.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.LeftMotorSpeed
member.summary: Speed of the left motor. Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100 percent motor use.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration
member.summary: Specifies motor speed levels for the vibration function of a controller.
member.remarks: The left motor is the low-frequency rumble motor. The right motor is the high-frequency rumble motor. The two motors are not the same, and they create different vibration effects.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceDataFormat
member.summary: The data format for a DirectInput device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectInput.CooperativeLevel
member.summary: Specifies the cooperative level for a DirectInput device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.CooperativeLevel.NonExclusive
member.summary: Non exclusive access to the device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags
member.summary: Specifies the flags that can be associated with a DirectInput device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.StartDelay
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports the start delay parameter for at least one effect.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.Saturation
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports the saturation of condition effects for at least one condition.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.PositiveNegativeSaturation
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports a maximum saturation for both positive and negative force output for at least one condition.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.PositiveNegativeCoefficients
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports two coefficient values for conditions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.PolledDevice
member.summary: At least one object on the device is polled, rather than interrupt driven.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.PolledDataFormat
member.summary: At least one object in the current data format is polled, rather than interrupt driven.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.Hidden
member.summary: The device is a fictious device created by a device driver so that is can generate mouse and keyboard events.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.ForceFeedbackAttack
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports the attack parameter for at least one effect.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.ForceFeedbackFade
member.summary: The force-feedback system supports the fade parameter for at least one effect.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.Emulated
member.summary: Specifies that the device's data is coming from a user mode device interface.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.DeadBand
member.summary: The device supports deadband for at least one force-feedback condition.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.Attached
member.summary: The device is physically attached to the user's computer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceFlags.Alias
member.summary: The device is a duplicate of another DirectInput device.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceType
member.summary: Specifies the main type of a DirectInput device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceType.Supplemental
member.summary: A specialized device with functionality unsuitable for main control of an application, such as pedals with a wheel.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceType.ControlDevice
member.summary: Input device used to control another type of device from within the context of the application.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceType.Other
member.summary: A device that does not fall into any other category.

member.summary: The axes are in relative mode.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DataFormatFlags.AbsoluteAxis
member.summary: The axes are in absolute mode.

member.summary: Specifies other attributes of an object data format.

member.summary: The object must report velocity information.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDataFormatFlags.Position
member.summary: The object must report position information.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDataFormatFlags.Force
member.summary: The object must report force information.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDataFormatFlags.Acceleration
member.summary: The object must report acceleration information.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType
member.summary: Specifies the device type of an object data format.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.VendorDefined
member.summary: The object must be a type defined by the manufacturer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.ToggleButton
member.summary: The object must be a toggle button.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.PushButton
member.summary: The object must be a push button.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.PointOfViewController
member.summary: The object must be a Point-Of-View controller.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.ForceFeedbackEffectTrigger
member.summary: The object must be a valid force-feedback effect trigger.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.ForceFeedbackActuator
member.summary: The object must contain a force-feedback actuator.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.Button
member.summary: The object must be a toggle or push button.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.RelativeAxis
member.summary: The object must be a relative axis.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.Axis
member.summary: The object must be an absolute or relative axis.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.ObjectDeviceType.AbsoluteAxis
member.summary: The object must be an absolute axis.

member.summary: Specifies the axis mode for the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceAxisMode.Relative
member.summary: The axis works with relative data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectInput.DeviceAxisMode.Absolute
member.summary: The axis works with absolute data.
